page.title: 12N. Lopham Post Office/Store
page.content: Mr. and Mrs. Pond own the Post Office in North Lopham. It is very convenient for the local people, because it means they can post their letters without going to the nearest town. They also sell butter, soap, flower seeds, cereals, pet foods, sweets, vegetables, tinned food, etc. Mr. and Mrs. Pond have lived in North Lopham for 13 years. When they first came here they didn't have many customers, but now they have a lot more. Their busiest day in the week is pension day, which is Thursday. They get about the same amount of custom from the Post Office as the Village Shop. They think there will be a future for small village shops, in spite of competition from larger town shops. They have never been burgled, though someone tried when they first moved in.
